snippet: Coach Mike D’Antoni is leaving in his fourth season, with the Knicks on a six-game losing streak and his offensive system at odds with the style of play of the star player Carmelo Anthony.
abstract: New York Knicks coach Mike D’Antoni resigns amid frustration, leaving in the middle of his fourth season, with the Knicks on a six-game losing streak and his offensive system at odds with the style of the star forward Carmelo Anthony; tension between D’Antoni and Anthony has been building for 13 months, since Anthony arrived in a controversial trade; assistant Mike Woodson will become interim coach.
lead_paragraph: Coach Mike D’Antoni is leaving in his fourth season, with the Knicks on a six-game losing streak and his offensive system at odds with the style of play of the star player Carmelo Anthony.

headline.seo: Mike D’Antoni Resigns as Knicks’ Coach
headline.print_headline: After Struggles, A Split: D’Antoni Resigns Amid Frustration
